  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* Signal handling, code specific to the native-code compiler */

  20. #include <signal.h>
  21. #include <errno.h>
  22. #include <stdio.h>
  23. #include "caml/codefrag.h"
  24. #include "caml/domain.h"
  25. #include "caml/fail.h"
  26. #include "caml/fiber.h"
  27. #include "caml/frame_descriptors.h"
  28. #include "caml/memory.h"
  29. #include "caml/osdeps.h"
  30. #include "caml/signals.h"
  31. #include "caml/stack.h"

  33. /* This routine is the common entry point for garbage collection
  34.    and signal handling.  It can trigger a callback to OCaml code.
  35.    With system threads, this callback can cause a context switch.
  36.    Hence [caml_garbage_collection] must not be called from regular C code
  37.    (e.g. the [caml_alloc] function) because the context of the call
  38.    (e.g. [intern_val]) may not allow context switching.
  39.    Only generated assembly code can call [caml_garbage_collection],
  40.    via the caml_call_gc assembly stubs.  */

  42. ‌void caml_garbage_collection(void)
  43. {
  44.   frame_descr* d;
  45.   caml_domain_state * dom_st = Caml_state;
  46.   caml_frame_descrs fds = caml_get_frame_descrs();
  47.   struct stack_info* stack = dom_st->current_stack;

  49.   char * sp = (char*)stack->sp;
  50.   Pop_frame_pointer(sp);
  51.   uintnat retaddr = *(uintnat*)sp;

  53.   /* Synchronise for the case when [young_limit] was used to interrupt
  54.      us. */
  55.   atomic_thread_fence(memory_order_acquire);

  57.   { /* Find the frame descriptor for the current allocation */
  58.     d = caml_find_frame_descr(fds, retaddr);
  59.     /* Must be an allocation frame */
  60.     CAMLassert(d && !frame_return_to_C(d) && frame_has_allocs(d));
  61.   }

  63.   { /* Compute the total allocation size at this point,
  64.        including allocations combined by Comballoc */
  65.     unsigned char* alloc_len = (unsigned char*)(&d->live_ofs[d->num_live]);
  66.     int i, nallocs = *alloc_len++;
  67.     intnat allocsz = 0;

  69.     if (nallocs == 0) {
  70.       /* This is a poll */
  71.       caml_process_pending_actions();
  72.       return;
  73.     }
  74.     else
  75.     {
  76.       for (i = 0; i < nallocs; i++) {
  77.         allocsz += Whsize_wosize(Wosize_encoded_alloc_len(alloc_len[i]));
  78.       }
  79.       /* We have computed whsize (including header)
  80.          but need wosize (without) */
  81.       allocsz -= 1;
  82.     }

  84.     caml_alloc_small_dispatch(dom_st, allocsz, CAML_DO_TRACK | CAML_FROM_CAML,
  85.                               nallocs, alloc_len);
  86.   }
  87. }
